Name: Statue fragment
Description: Fragment of a statue base, the right thigh and toes still survive, plus detail of a finely pleated kilt. The statue depicted the Pharaoh Tuthmosis III, probably kneeling and offering to a deity, possibly Amun-Re. The work is detailed, for example the toe-nails. There is an inscription on the top of the base giving the name of the king, traces of blue pigment remain in the hieroglyphs.
